verses.roman:
tabe rāmānanda krame kahite lāgilā
kṛṣṇa-kathā-rasāmṛta-sindhu uthalilā

synonyms: tabe—thereupon; rāmānanda—Rāmānanda Rāya; krame—gradually; kahite lāgilā—began to speak; kṛṣṇa-kathā—of the topics of Kṛṣṇa; rasāmṛta-sindhu—the ocean of transcendental mellow; uthalilā—became agitated.
translation: Thereupon Rāmānanda Rāya gradually began speaking on topics of Kṛṣṇa. Thus the ocean of the transcendental mellow of those topics became agitated.
